lexUnit.name: sidle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: walk in a furtive or stealthy manner, especially sideways or obliquely

sentence.text: She sidled along the drive after her husband and up to the front door .
The path to the abbey ruins was under water , but I managed to keep dry by sidling along the edge , holding on to a fence .
Jessie sidled along by the racks to the door leading to the passage and the stairs .
Bower-bird sidled along the branch away from Cassowary .
Praying , as she sidled along to the changing-room , that no one would ever know how utterly wrong she had been …
She would not allow him to sidle away into the night leaving her to kow-tow to an irate Spittals in the morning .
The men were sidling in , wondering what the hell was going to happen .
Crilly sidles in beside me with two double shots of Jameson 's .
She decided to risk going back , she opened the door and sidled in .
They sidled off with perfect ease
` I 'll leave you with young Hot-to-Trotsky here , then , " Clare says , patting Yvonne on the shoulder and winking at me as she sidles off through the cheering crowd .
When Sigarup climbed up the ladder , straining under the weight of his basket , the dog sidled over to him with a low unearthly grunt of pleasure .
Trying to avoid gazing at the grisly sight , the Leutnant sidled over to the statuesque Karnstein , and handed the envelope to her .
Wully Gurk sidled up and squeezed himself on to the end of the seat .
A cowboy sauntered over to the bar , and sidled up next to them .
Tavalouze sidled up behind him and said in a low voice , ` Remove your hood , the veil .
Elsie had wept for kind Mrs Doran and for her husband , that strange , silent , sympathetic man , lifting his feet cautiously as he sidled across the polished floor .
He sidled into the reception cubby and addressed his receptionist , an eerily svelte woman-form of perfect shape and minimal , pixie-like features .
I sidled into the room , scarcely daring to breathe lest I harm the recording .
He sidled into the utility room , treading with remembered caution , and reached for the light switch .
She sent him a haunted look , stammered that she was going , and tried to sidle past him .
The Jag blocked the whole alleyway , barely leaving enough room for someone to sidle past it .
Six sulky girls sidled through the door .
She sidled cautiously towards the equipment , and perched on the edge of a deep mahogany box .
I sidle up to the older cop .
He fumbled the spectacles onto his face just as three muddy children sidled toward him .
Archie had sidled adroitly past her .
Wriggling through the crowds , I sidled around the walls , admiring black and white photographs of old men in cloth caps playing fiddles , while children looked on wonderingly .
As Marian and Allen were taking in this scene one of the attackers slipped to one side and sidled around the tree towards the Friar 's unprotected flank .
After dinner in the hotel restaurant David enjoyed sidling down the road .
